summary: This document contains various personnel records related to Jeffrey Epstein's employment at Bear, Stearns & Co., including salary changes, employment history, and references from previous employers. It also includes details about Epstein's education and personal background.

connections.description: Mark Epstein is Jeffrey's brother, involved in a business venture with him.
Mavis Lewis provided academic records for Epstein from New York University.
Dr. Wolf was a supervisor at the University of California, Berkeley, where Epstein was reportedly employed.
Rita Goodman is the owner of the property where Epstein lived.
Jeffrey Nier was a former employer of Epstein, providing a reference about his work performance.

events.title: Lawsuit Filed by New York University
events.description: New York University filed a lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein for an unpaid check.

locations: Dalton School, 108 East 89th Street, New York, NY
New York University, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein resigned from Bear, Stearns & Co. on March 12, 1981.
Epstein began his employment at Bear, Stearns & Co. on March 15, 1976.
New York University filed a lawsuit against Epstein on January 28, 1975, for an unpaid check.
Epstein was involved in a business venture with his brother Mark Epstein making and selling silk screen paintings.
Epstein's educational background includes attendance at Cooper Union and New York University, but he did not graduate from either institution.
